paper_abstract: A k-total-coloring of a graph G is a coloring of V(G) boolean OR E(G) using k colors such that no two adjacent or incident elements receive the same color. A graph G is k-total-colorable if it admits a k-total-coloring. In this paper, it is proved that any graph G which can be embedded in a surface Sigma of Euler characteristic chi(Sigma) >= 0 is (Delta(G) + 2)-total-colorable if Delta(G) >= 7, where Delta(G) denotes the maximum degree of G. (C) 2013 Elsevier B.V. All rights reserved.
paper_title: Total coloring of embedded graphs with maximum degree at least seven
